instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: macbook air 2020 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message:
Hello,

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with a water damage at the titan ridge area, surrounding area cleared up.
macbook now boots with battery but not charging. 20v when plugged in charger but 20ma. customer took back macbook for data backup, brought back laptop with depleted battery to be fixed. 
checked the battery, it is now busted, and won't take a charge. Replaced with new battery but does not boot now. Does not boot without battery installed as well.

here is where things get weird. on the old busted battery. when i plug in charger i get a low battery icon on screen
where do i start?

threads.title: macbook air 2020 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message:
So the new battery doesn't even show low battery icon on start?
Can you post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with each battery connected?
Do NOT connect the charger.

With only charger connected, post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.title: macbook air 2020 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message:
on the old battery is 0v at the connector but 10.9V at the terminals, guess the battery controller board is dead somehow
on the new battery connector 11.3v ppbus is 11.3v and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.2V

i want to add as well that the low battery sign does not consistently come up.. sometimes it does, sometimes it does not when i unplug and reinsert charger

threads.title: macbook air 2020 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message:
There should still be something affected by liquid.
Check what happens disconnecting trackpad/keyboard.
